events.title: Start of the American Revolutionary War
events.description: The Battles of Lexington and Concord were fought on April 19, 1775, marking the outbreak of armed conflict between Great Britain and its thirteen colonies in America.
events.significance: This event is considered the start of the American Revolutionary War, eventually leading to the independence of the United States.

events.title: The Warsaw Ghetto Uprising Begins
events.description: Jewish inhabitants of the Warsaw Ghetto in Nazi-occupied Poland staged an armed revolt against the German efforts to transport the remaining ghetto population to concentration camps.
events.significance: It was one of the first large-scale urban uprisings against Nazi occupation and has come to symbolize resistance against oppression.

events.title: Waco Siege Begins
events.description: A 51-day standoff began between the Branch Davidians, a religious sect, and federal agents at their compound near Waco, Texas.
events.significance: This event highlighted issues of government law enforcement, religious freedom, and led to debates on federal authority.

events.title: Hitler's Last Birthday Marked by the Beginning of the Battle of Berlin
events.description: Around April 19, Soviet forces began the final assault on the German capital during World War II as Nazi Germany faced imminent defeat.
events.significance: The Battle of Berlin was a decisive battle resulting in the end of Nazi Germany and marking the conclusion of the war in Europe.
